ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: 1. Educates 100 blind & deaf children. 2. Service centre for deaf. It provides speech therapy, auditory services to about 250 H.I. persons annualy. 3. A Small Physiotherapy unit that helped 450 patients so far. 4. An extention counter for providing special Braille equipment to visually impaired persons of bihar & Jharkhand. 5. Distribution of Braille Equipment, Hearing Aids, Tricycles etc to more than 500 PWDs. 6. A CBR program in Kanti, Marban, Kudhani, Mushari Blocks of Muzaffarpur. We work in rights mode. Health check-up, awareness and diagnostic Camps are also organised in rural areas for disabled. Interest free loan for starting small business are also being provided to PWDs. 7. mental Health Program that provides Free medication, diagnosis & economic rehabilitation. 192 patients are getting regular help. 8. We educate and rehabilitate 40 mentally retarded children. 9. We are the study centre for foundation course for inservice teacher, diploma and P.G. Diploma in C.B.R. and Braille teaching centre. We work in human resource development in collaboration with IGNOU, Bangalore university and M.P.B.O.U. 10. In 2008 we started a Pre-School for 20 C.P. Children. 11. Computer centre was established for disabled in 2000 with the help of Rotary Club of Campt Vally, Kanada provides basic computer knowledge to school children and produces audio books for the benefit of blind students.

ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: Swarnim Adhyaya is a regd organisation under societies registration Act 21 1860 & as the name suggests its an adhyaya which is a chapter towards a developed india mechanism We have accomplished many projects like health check up camps postcard awareness initiatives sponsor the indias future etc but to be frank we have only health camp in our achievement list because we believe project achievement always rely on the no of beneficiaries & we got satisfactory results only in our health camp project now the question arise what we did a lot of things but that doesnt matter now because counting always starts from there where the world knows which is a fact but the reality is in todays world social work also requires money ie why we would not waste your time guys by giving u misleading datas about what we did but we are always ready for everyone who wants to know what we can because thats gonna make the real difference rest everything is secondary.

ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: There is acute need of the Day for development of the State, Society and Country for economic, social, moral and other aspect and other aspect of National Development. The country is passing various diversities. Our society is engaged in this direction by implementation of various development schemes - (1) For identification, survey, sansitisation of disable persons (2) For skill development, specialised treatment, vocational training. For fitment of assistive devices (artificial aids and appliances) to disabled person (3) For skill development training provision of sheltered short stay home, psychological counseling, legal helps to suffering women (4) Society is working in the area - tribal, rural, hilly, undeveloped areas, semi urban areas, etc. affected area due to national clarities (5) Preservation of wild animal, innocent animal other groups of animal (6) Skill development for youth group (7) Working in area of child labour, women labour bended labour, etc. (8) Community based rehabilitation covering various village of the state/district (9) Working for integral human advancement of mankind as a whole
